cap:
In the snowy forest, Risuko stopped in her tracks.
She had the look of someone deep in thought.
And usually, at times like this, she has already come up with something.

Risuko "..."
Suzuko "That thinking face already looks like an answer."

Footsteps came from behind.
When she turned around, it was just who she expected.
In the forest, reunions like this happen quickly.

Risuko "Oh, Suzuko."
Suzuko "Good morning."

When Risuko blew the whistle, something stirred deep in the forest.
As usual, a tanuki came over to see what was going on.

Risuko "When I play it, they usually come."
Suzuko "They are coming to listen."

Suzuko stared at the whistle in Risuko's hands.
After thinking for a moment, she looked up.

Risuko "Do you want to try playing it too, Suzuko?"
Suzuko "I never have, but..."

With that answer, the decision was already made.

Risuko "Then let's practice together."
Suzuko "Yeah."

When their sounds overlapped, the forest rustled.
The tanuki looked as if it had been waiting for this.
Risuko glanced over to check.

Risuko "That was fast."
Suzuko "They do not miss a thing."

This time, it was only Suzuko's sound.
The tanuki stayed a little farther away, listening closely.

Risuko "Yeah, this one passes."
Suzuko "Not coming closer somehow makes it scarier."

The air grew colder, and their breath turned white.
Risuko shrugged and pointed deeper into the forest.
Behind them, the tanuki followed as if it were the most natural thing.

Risuko "It's cold. Let's change places."
Suzuko "It's following us."

They sat down on a tree branch.
Right beside them, naturally, was the tanuki.
Up high, the wind should have been cold,
but sitting together somehow felt a little warm.
The tanuki swayed its tail, looking satisfied with the spot.

Risuko "This place is nice."
Suzuko "Yeah."
Suzuko "Even the tanuki is relaxing."

Before they knew it, the tanuki was sitting right between them.
It was very good at judging distance.
And it looked perfectly calm.
No matter how you looked at it, this was clearly its assigned seat.

Risuko "...When did you get there?"
Suzuko "I feel like it was between us from the start."
Risuko "That kind of arrangement exists, huh."

As the performance ended, the tanuki jumped at them playfully.
Instead of sound, it threw its whole body into them.
Apparently, all of its feedback was packed into that.
The forest was quiet, but this spot alone was lively.

Risuko "...So, did we pass?"
Suzuko "Perfect score."

After becoming completely friendly with the tanuki,
Risuko thought for a moment.
If this worked, maybe they could get along with other animals too.

Risuko "Hey, Suzuko, want to try singing?"
Suzuko "Huh?"

Caught off guard by the sudden suggestion, Suzuko thought briefly.
She pictured the forest, then replied in a calm voice.

Risuko "See, the tanuki came too."
Suzuko "Then maybe... a hymn?"

They looked at each other,
then took a breath as if searching for the timing.
Their pitch and entrances were not aligned yet.
Still, their voices clearly carried into the forest.

Risuko "...la, lalala."
Suzuko "Um... la, lala... maybe?"

As they kept singing, they started to find their rhythm.
Before they knew it, the song had become something different from what they first imagined.

Risuko "This is not a hymn anymore."
Suzuko "It's completely original now."

Just then, there was a sound at their feet.
A squirrel had stopped there.

Risuko "Oh, it's listening."
Suzuko "It stopped."

Before they realized it, the presence around them had increased.
From all over the forest, attention gathered.

Risuko "Did it increase?"
Suzuko "Yeah, it's turning into a small venue."

A deer stopped and listened for a while.
Then, as if nothing had happened, it walked away.

Risuko "It left."
Suzuko "Just a passing guest."

When she glanced to the side, an owl was right there.
Even this close, it made no sound at all.

Risuko "...Isn't that close?"
Suzuko "Might be the best seat."

As they sang, their eyes met again and again.
And every time, neither looked away.

Risuko "We are being watched."
Suzuko "We are being listened to."

Before they noticed, birds were flying around them.
The song seemed to circle through the forest
and come back again.

Risuko "It feels like it's reaching them."
Suzuko "Yeah. Properly."

The song lasted longer than they expected.
Without finding a reason to stop,
the sky slowly changed its colors.

Risuko "We can still sing."
Suzuko "Yeah. Until night."

At some point, their roles settled naturally.
One voice leading, the other supporting it.

Suzuko "Then I'll take the lead."
Risuko "Okay. I'll back you up."

Risuko picked up something nearby to use as a pretend microphone.
It did not need to be real. The feeling was enough.

Risuko "Okay, next is me."
Suzuko "That was a quick switch."

As they sang, their bodies began to move.
There was no choreography.
But somehow, it fit perfectly.

Risuko "Next, here we go."
Suzuko "Yeah. Together."

Before they realized it, the forest was completely dark.
When they looked up, the stars were neatly lined across the sky.

Risuko "...It's night."
Suzuko "You do not notice when you are singing."

When the song ended, silence returned.
That silence wrapped gently around the sounds from before.

Risuko "There's still an aftertaste."
Suzuko "Yeah. It's lingering."

While resting a bit, they talked about memories.
All of them were connected to today.

Risuko "Do you remember that song back then?"
Suzuko "Yeah. At first, it did not match at all."

As the night wind grew colder,
they moved to a warmer place.
By the fire, they sang just a little more.

Risuko "Here, our voices settle down."
Suzuko "Singing softly is nice too."

After things calmed down, the sound of their stomachs brought them back to reality.

Risuko "...Shall we go eat?"
Suzuko "Yeah. Perfect timing."

On the way, they ran into a familiar figure.
It was the same tanuki they had befriended first.
Things moved quickly, and plans were decided naturally.

Risuko "Oh, the first one."
Suzuko "Come with us."
Tanuki "..."

And so, the night of song flowed seamlessly into a shared meal.
